result.execSummary:
The defendant Colin A Petri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County. Sentence credit of 65 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with co-defendant or victim listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 279 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Costs previously imposed are still due and to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Court Reporter, Cheryl Humpal - From Sentencing on Revocation held on 04/07/17.

Defendant Colin A Petri in court with Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caes called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Sonderhouse makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 279 days)
  -   18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 
  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____No contact with victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaint

COSTS (previously ordered):  $554.40 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Correction.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 7, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

read-in list filed by the state

Defendant Colin A Petri in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  State files read-in list.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS  (65 days credit, if revoked)       **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant's or victim listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done


COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant


**Court denies request for expunction**

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim or Gary W, Seth K, Garcia S, Kaitlyn S as listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
